analyzed: dhammasaṅgaṇī
translated: The Numerical Discourses

analyzed: niddesa
translated: The Analyses

analyzed: akusala vipāka abyākata
translated: The Chapter on the Arising of Thoughts🔽… Resultant without root-cause …

analyzed: akusala vipāka pañca viññāṇa
translated: … Resultant mind-element without root-cause …

analyzed: katame dhammā a byākatā
translated: What are the unwholesome thoughts?

original: Yasmiṁ samaye akusalassa kammassa katattā upacitattā vipākaṁ cakkhuviññāṇaṁ uppannaṁ hoti upekkhāsahagataṁ rūpārammaṇaṁ …pe…🔽sotaviññāṇaṁ uppannaṁ hoti upekkhāsahagataṁ saddārammaṇaṁ …pe…
analyzed: yasmin samaye akusalassa kammassa katattā upacitattā vipākam cakkhu viññāṇam uppannam hoti upekkhā sahagatam rūpa ārammaṇam pe  sota viññāṇam uppannam hoti upekkhā sahagatam sadda ārammaṇam pe
translated: When, as a result of past unwholesome deeds, eye-consciousness has arisen accompanied by equanimity, and it is aware of a form,🔽or when ear-consciousness has arisen accompanied by equanimity, and it is aware of a sound,

original: ghānaviññāṇaṁ uppannaṁ hoti upekkhāsahagataṁ gandhārammaṇaṁ …pe…🔽jivhāviññāṇaṁ uppannaṁ hoti upekkhāsahagataṁ rasārammaṇaṁ …pe…🔽kāyaviññāṇaṁ uppannaṁ hoti dukkhasahagataṁ phoṭṭhabbārammaṇaṁ, tasmiṁ samaye phasso
analyzed: ghāna viññāṇam uppannam hoti upekkhā sahagatam gandha ārammaṇam pe  jivhā viññāṇam uppannam hoti upekkhā sahagatam rasa ārammaṇam pe  kāya viññāṇam uppannam hoti dukkha sahagatam phoṭṭhabba ārammaṇa tasmin samaye phasso
translated: or when nose-consciousness has arisen accompanied by equanimity, and it is aware of a smell,🔽or when tongue-consciousness has arisen accompanied by equanimity, and it is aware of a taste,

original: hoti, vedanā hoti, saññā hoti, cetanā hoti, cittaṁ hoti, dukkhaṁ hoti, cittassekaggatā
analyzed: hoti vedanā hoti saññā hoti cetanā hoti cittam hoti dukkham hoti cittassa ekagga tā
translated: or when body-consciousness has arisen accompanied by pain, and it is aware of a tangible, at that time there is contact, there is feeling, there is perception, there is intention, there is thought, there is pain, there is one-pointedness of mind,

original: hoti, manindriyaṁ hoti, dukkhindriyaṁ hoti, jīvitindriyaṁ hoti;
analyzed: hoti manindriyam hoti dukkhindriyam hoti jīvitindriyam hoti
translated: there is the mind faculty, there is the pain faculty, there is the life faculty;

original: ye vā pana tasmiṁ samaye aññepi atthi paṭiccasamuppannā arūpino dhammā—
analyzed: ye vā pana tasmin samaye aññe pi atthi paṭiccasamuppannāḥ arūpino dhammā
translated: Or whatever other incorporeal, causally induced phenomena there are at that time—

analyzed: ime dhammā a byākatā
translated: these are the indeterminate phenomena.

analyzed: katamaḥ tasmin samaye phassaḥ hoti
translated: What is contact at that time?

original: Yo tasmiṁ samaye phasso phusanā samphusanā samphusitattaṁ—
analyzed: yaḥ tasmin samaye phassaḥ
translated: That which at that time is contact, contacting, being in contact—

analyzed: ayam tasmin samaye phassaḥ hoti
translated: this is the contact at that time.

analyzed: katamā tasmin samaye vedanā ha iti
translated: What is feeling at that time?

original: Yaṁ tasmiṁ samaye tajjākāyaviññāṇadhātusamphassajaṁ kāyikaṁ asātaṁ kāyikaṁ dukkhaṁ kāyasamphassajaṁ asātaṁ dukkhaṁ vedayitaṁ kāyasamphassajā asātā dukkhā vedanā—
analyzed: yam tasmin samaye tajjā kāya viññāṇa dhātu samphassa jam kāyikam asātam kāyikam dukkham kāya samphassa jam asātam dukkham vedayitam kāya samphassa jā asātā dukkhā vedanā
translated: That which at that time is the painful bodily feeling born of body-contact, the painful bodily sensation, painfulness born of body-contact, painful sensation born of body-contact—

analyzed: ayam tasmin samaye vedanā
translated: this is the feeling at that time. …

original: Katamaṁ tasmiṁ samaye dukkhaṁ hoti?🔽Yaṁ tasmiṁ samaye kāyikaṁ asātaṁ kāyikaṁ dukkhaṁ kāyasamphassajaṁ asātaṁ dukkhaṁ vedayitaṁ kāyasamphassajā asātā dukkhā vedanā—
analyzed: katamam tasmin samaye dukkham hoti  yam tasmin samaye kāyikam asātam kāyikam dukkham kāya samphassa jam asātam dukkham vedayitam kāya samphassa jā asātā dukkhā vedanā
translated: What is pain at that time?🔽That which at that time is the painful bodily feeling born of body-contact, the painful bodily sensation, painfulness born of body-contact, painful sensation born of body-contact—

analyzed: idam tasmin samaye dukkham hoti pe
translated: this is the pain at that time. …

analyzed: katamam tasmin samaye dukkha indriyam hoti
translated: What is the pain faculty at that time?

original: Yaṁ tasmiṁ samaye kāyikaṁ asātaṁ kāyikaṁ dukkhaṁ kāyasamphassajaṁ asātaṁ dukkhaṁ vedayitaṁ kāyasamphassajā asātā dukkhā vedanā—
analyzed: yam tasmin samaye kāyikam asātam kāyikam dukkham kāya samphassa jam asātam dukkham vedayitam kāya samphassa jā asātā dukkhā vedanā
translated: Whatever at that time is bodily discomfort, bodily pain, painful bodily feeling arisen from contact with the body, painful bodily feeling due to contact with the body—🔽

original: idaṁ tasmiṁ samaye dukkhindriyaṁ hoti …pe…🔽ye vā pana tasmiṁ samaye aññepi atthi paṭiccasamuppannā arūpino dhammā—🔽ime dhammā abyākatā.
analyzed: idam tasmin samaye dukkha indriyam hoti pe  ye vā pana tasmin samaye aññe pi atthi paṭiccasamuppannāḥ arūpino dhammā  ime dhammā a byākatā
translated: Whatever at that time is bodily discomfort, bodily suffering, painful bodily feeling born of contact with the body — this at that time is the pain faculty. …

original: Tasmiṁ kho pana samaye cattāro khandhā honti, dvāyatanāni honti, dve dhātuyo honti,
analyzed: tasmin kho pana samaye cattāraḥ khandhāḥ honti dvā āyatanāni honti dve dhātuyaḥ honti
translated: At that time, there are four aggregates, two sense-spheres, two elements,

original: tayo āhārā honti, tīṇindriyāni honti, eko phasso hoti …pe… ekā kāyaviññāṇadhātu hoti,
analyzed: tayaḥ āhārāḥ honti tīṇi indriyāni honti ekaḥ phassaḥ hoti pe ekā kāya viññāṇa dhātu hoti
translated: three nutriments, three faculties, one contact, … one body-consciousness element,

original: ekaṁ dhammāyatanaṁ hoti, ekā dhammadhātu hoti;🔽ye vā pana tasmiṁ samaye aññepi atthi paṭiccasamuppannā arūpino dhammā—
analyzed: ekam dhamma āyatanam hoti ekā dhammadhātu hoti  ye vā pana tasmin samaye aññe pi atthi paṭiccasamuppannāḥ arūpino dhammā
translated: one mind element, one mind-consciousness element, one thing cognizable via the mind, one sphere of mental data, one mind-consciousness,

analyzed: ime dhammā a byākatā pe
translated: or whatever other incorporeal, causally induced mental qualities there are at that time — these are conditionally originated mental qualities. …

analyzed: katamaḥ tasmin samaye saṅkhāra kkhandho hoti
translated: What at that time is the aggregate of volitional formations?

analyzed: phasso cetanā cittassa ekagga tā jīvitindriya
translated: Contact, volition, one-pointedness of mind, the life faculty;

original: ye vā pana tasmiṁ samaye aññepi atthi paṭiccasamuppannā arūpino dhammā ṭhapetvā vedanākkhandhaṁ ṭhapetvā saññākkhandhaṁ ṭhapetvā viññāṇakkhandhaṁ—
analyzed: ye vā pana tasmin samaye aññe pi atthi paṭiccasamuppannāḥ arūpino dhammāḥ ṭhapetvā vedanā kkhandham ṭhapetvā saññā kkhandham ṭhapetvā viññāṇa kkhandham
translated: or whatever other incorporeal, causally induced mental properties there are at that time, apart from feeling, apart from perception, and apart from consciousness—

analyzed: ayam tasmin samaye saṅkhāra kkhandho hoti pe
translated: this is the volitional formations aggregate at that time …

analyzed: ime dhammā a byākatā
translated: These are the unwholesome thoughts.

analyzed: akusala vipāka pañca viññāṇāni
translated: The five resultants of unwholesome deeds are consciousness.

analyzed: a kusala vipāka manaḥ dhātu
translated: The resultant mind element that is unwholesome

analyzed: katame dhammā a byākatā
translated: What are the indeterminate thoughts?

original: Yasmiṁ samaye akusalassa kammassa katattā upacitattā vipākā manodhātu uppannā hoti upekkhāsahagatā rūpārammaṇā vā …pe…
analyzed: yasmin samaye akusalassa kammassa katattā upacitattā vipākā manaḥ dhātu uppannā hoti upekkhā sahagatā rūpa ārammaṇā vā pe
translated: When, as a result of past unwholesome deeds, the resultant mind element has arisen accompanied by equanimity, with a form object …🔽with a sound object … with an odor object … with a taste object … with a tangible object object …

original: phoṭṭhabbārammaṇā vā yaṁ yaṁ vā panārabbha, tasmiṁ samaye phasso hoti, vedanā hoti,🔽saññā hoti, cetanā hoti, cittaṁ hoti, vitakko hoti, vicāro hoti, upekkhā hoti, cittassekaggatā
analyzed: phoṭṭhabba ārammaṇāḥ vā yam yam vā pana ārabbha tasmin samaye phassaḥ hoti vedanā hoti  saññā hoti cetanā hoti cittam hoti vitakkaḥ hoti vicāraḥ hoti upekkhā hoti cittassa ekagga tā
translated: with whatever object, at that time there is contact, there is feeling,🔽there is perception, there is intention, there is thought, there is thinking, there is reflection, there is equanimity, there is one-pointedness of mind,

original: hoti, manindriyaṁ hoti, upekkhindriyaṁ hoti, jīvitindriyaṁ hoti;
analyzed: hoti manindriyam hoti upekkhindriyam hoti jīvitindriyam hoti
translated: there is the mind faculty, there is the equanimity faculty, there is the life faculty;

original: ye vā pana tasmiṁ samaye aññepi atthi paṭiccasamuppannā arūpino dhammā—
analyzed: ye vā pana tasmin samaye aññe pi atthi paṭiccasamuppannāḥ arūpino dhammā
translated: Whatever other incorporeal, causally induced phenomena there are at that time—

analyzed: ime dhammā a byākatā pe
translated: these phenomena are indeterminate. …

original: Tasmiṁ kho pana samaye cattāro khandhā honti, dvāyatanāni honti, dve dhātuyo honti,
analyzed: tasmin kho pana samaye cattāraḥ khandhāḥ honti dvā āyatanāni honti dve dhātuyaḥ honti
translated: At that time there are four components, two media, two elements,

original: tayo āhārā honti, tīṇindriyāni honti, eko phasso hoti …pe… ekā manodhātu hoti, ekaṁ
analyzed: tayaḥ āhārāḥ honti tīṇi indriyāni honti ekaḥ phassaḥ hoti pe ekā manaḥ dhātu hoti eka
translated: three nutriments, three faculties, one contact, … one perception, … one intention, … one thought, …

analyzed: dhamma āyatanam hoti ekā dhammadhātu hoti
translated: one mind element, one mind-consciousness element,🔽one thing cognizable via mind-consciousness,

original: ye vā pana tasmiṁ samaye aññepi atthi paṭiccasamuppannā arūpino dhammā—
analyzed: ye vā pana tasmin samaye aññe pi atthi paṭiccasamuppannāḥ arūpino dhammā
translated: Whatever other incorporeal, causally induced phenomena there are at that time—

analyzed: ime dhammā a byākatā pe
translated: these phenomena are indeterminate. …

analyzed: katamaḥ tasmin samaye saṅkhāra kkhandho hoti
translated: What at that time is the determinations component?

original: Phasso cetanā vitakko vicāro cittassekaggatā jīvitindriyaṁ;
analyzed: phasso cetanā vitakko vicāro cittassa ekagga tā jīvitindriya
translated: Contact, volition, applied thought, sustained thought, one-pointedness of mind, the life faculty,

original: ye vā pana tasmiṁ samaye aññepi atthi paṭiccasamuppannā arūpino dhammā ṭhapetvā vedanākkhandhaṁ ṭhapetvā saññākkhandhaṁ ṭhapetvā viññāṇakkhandhaṁ—
analyzed: ye vā pana tasmin samaye aññe pi atthi paṭiccasamuppannāḥ arūpino dhammāḥ ṭhapetvā vedanā kkhandham ṭhapetvā saññā kkhandham ṭhapetvā viññāṇa kkhandham
translated: Whatever other incorporeal, causally induced phenomena there are at that time, apart from feeling, apart from perception, apart from the consciousness component—

analyzed: ayam tasmin samaye saṅkhāra kkhandho hoti pe
translated: at that time there is the volitional formations aggregate …

analyzed: ime dhammā a byākatā  akusala vipākāḥ manaḥ dhātu
translated: These are the states that are indeterminate.🔽The mind element that is the result of unprofitable action.

analyzed: akusala vipāka manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu
translated: The mind-consciousness element that is the result of unprofitable action.

analyzed: katame dhammā a byākatā
translated: What are the states that are indeterminate?

original: Yasmiṁ samaye akusalassa kammassa katattā upacitattā vipākā manoviññāṇadhātu uppannā hoti upekkhāsahagatā rūpārammaṇā vā …pe…
analyzed: yasmin samaye akusalassa kammassa katattā upacitattā vipākā manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu uppannā hoti upekkhā sahagatā rūpa ārammaṇā vā pe
translated: On an occasion when the mind-consciousness element has arisen that is the result of unprofitable action, accompanied by equanimity, with a form object …🔽with a sound object … with a mind object, whatever exists,

original: dhammārammaṇā vā yaṁ yaṁ vā panārabbha, tasmiṁ samaye phasso hoti, vedanā hoti, saññā
analyzed: dhamma ārammaṇāḥ vā yam yam vā pana ārabbha tasmin samaye phassaḥ hoti vedanā hoti saññā
translated: at that time contact exists, feeling exists, perception exists, volition exists, mind exists, applied thought exists, sustained thought exists, equanimity exists, one-pointedness of mind exists,

original: hoti, cetanā hoti, cittaṁ hoti, vitakko hoti, vicāro hoti, upekkhā hoti, cittassekaggatā🔽hoti, manindriyaṁ hoti, upekkhindriyaṁ hoti, jīvitindriyaṁ hoti;
analyzed: hoti cetanā hoti cittam hoti vitakkaḥ hoti vicāraḥ hoti upekkhā hoti cittassa ekagga tā  hoti manindriyam hoti upekkhindriyam hoti jīvitindriyam hoti
translated: the mind faculty exists, the equanimity faculty exists, the life faculty exists;

original: ye vā pana tasmiṁ samaye aññepi atthi paṭiccasamuppannā arūpino dhammā—
analyzed: ye vā pana tasmin samaye aññe pi atthi paṭiccasamuppannāḥ arūpino dhammā
translated: and whatever else there is at that time that is form, that is formless, that is clung to, that arises from causes, that is non-supernatural, that is included among the determinations, that is the internal, that is contingent—

analyzed: ime dhammā a byākatā pe
translated: these are states that are indeterminate.

original: Tasmiṁ kho pana samaye cattāro khandhā honti, dvāyatanāni honti, dve dhātuyo honti,
analyzed: tasmin kho pana samaye cattāraḥ khandhāḥ honti dvā āyatanāni honti dve dhātuyaḥ honti
translated: On that occasion there are four aggregates, two sense spheres, two elements,

original: tayo āhārā honti, tīṇindriyāni honti, eko phasso hoti …pe… ekā manoviññāṇadhātu hoti,🔽ekaṁ dhammāyatanaṁ hoti, ekā dhammadhātu hoti;
analyzed: tayaḥ āhārāḥ honti tīṇi indriyāni honti ekaḥ phassaḥ hoti pe ekā manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu hoti  ekam dhamma āyatanam hoti ekā dhammadhātu hoti
translated: one mind-consciousness element, one thing cognizable via the mind-element,

original: ye vā pana tasmiṁ samaye aññepi atthi paṭiccasamuppannā arūpino dhammā—
analyzed: ye vā pana tasmin samaye aññe pi atthi paṭiccasamuppannāḥ arūpino dhammā
translated: and whatever other inconstant, incorporeal, non-life-faculty phenomena there are on that occasion—

analyzed: ime dhammā a byākatā pe
translated: these are said to be “unwholesome thoughts”.🔽What on that occasion is the aggregate of volitional formations?

original: Katamo tasmiṁ samaye saṅkhārakkhandho hoti?🔽Phasso cetanā vitakko vicāro cittassekaggatā jīvitindriyaṁ;
analyzed: katamaḥ tasmin samaye saṅkhāra kkhandho hoti  phasso cetanā vitakko vicāro cittassa ekagga tā jīvitindriya
translated: Contact, volition, applied thought, sustained thought, one-pointedness of mind, the life faculty,

original: ye vā pana tasmiṁ samaye aññepi atthi paṭiccasamuppannā arūpino dhammā ṭhapetvā vedanākkhandhaṁ ṭhapetvā saññākkhandhaṁ ṭhapetvā viññāṇakkhandhaṁ—
analyzed: ye vā pana tasmin samaye aññe pi atthi paṭiccasamuppannāḥ arūpino dhammāḥ ṭhapetvā vedanā kkhandham ṭhapetvā saññā kkhandham ṭhapetvā viññāṇa kkhandham
translated: and whatever other incorporeal, non-life-faculty phenomena there are on that occasion that are on the side of the formations, apart from feeling, apart from perception, apart from consciousness—

analyzed: ayam tasmin samaye saṅkhāra kkhandho hoti pe
translated: this, on that occasion, is the aggregate of volitional formations.
